Adjust P-values

Source: R/adjust_p.R
adjust_p.Rd

Adjust P-values of a tidy_summary object

adjust_p(x, method)

# S3 method for tidy_summary
adjust_p(x, method = "BH")

Arguments

x

a tidy_summary object.
method

(chr, default = "BH") a valid method for p.adjust

Value

a tidy_summary object with the Ps adjusted

Examples

library(Hmisc)
my_summary <- summary(Species ~ ., data = iris, method = "reverse")

tidy_summary(my_summary) %>%
  adjust_p()
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `P-value`.
#> ✖ The object `x` does not have a P-value column.
#>   Have you select `test = TRUE` in the `summary` call?
#> ✖ `x` is returned without changes.
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>   `&nbsp;`     `setosa \n(N=50)`   `versicolor \n(N=50)` `virginica \n(N=50)`

#> 2 Sepal.Width  "3.200/3.400/3.675" "2.525/2.800/3.000"   "2.800/3.000/3.175"
